tokens.resolved_gloss: to redeem (according to the Oriental law of kinship), i.e. to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
tokens.translation: to redeem (according to the Oriental law of kinship), i.e. to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)

tokens.resolved_gloss: Boaz, the ancestor of David; also the name of a pillar in front of the temple
tokens.translation: Boaz, the ancestor of David; also the name of a pillar in front of the temple

tokens.resolved_gloss: to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
tokens.translation: to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own

tokens.resolved_gloss: to pull out, up or off

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, a sandal tongue; by extension a sandal or slipper (sometimes as a symbol of occupancy, a refusal to marry, or of something valueless)
